intro: Psychotria chlorotica var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense rainforest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
